summary: Reduces the idle chatter and social conversations NPCs have between you, and themselves.
descriptionHtml:
---------------------------------
Description
---------------------------------

Reduces the idle chatter and social conversations NPCs have between you, and themselves. 

The game settings changed were:

fCombatDialogueTauntMaxElapsedTime
	30 to 60
fCombatDialogueTauntMinElapsedTime
	10 to 30
fAISocialRadiusToTriggerConversation
	500 to 50
fAIGreetingTimer
	5 to 40
fAIExclusiveGreetingTimer
	2.5 to 30
fAIForceGreetingTimer
	3 to 40
fAIInDialogueModeWithPlayerDistance	
	500 to 50
iAISocialDistanceToTriggerEvent
	200 to 50
fIdleChatterCommentTimerMax
	20 to 60
fIdleChatterCommentTimer
	10 to 30
fCommentOnPlayerActionsTimer
	20 to 40
fCombatDialogueAttackMinElapsedTime
	5 to 30
fCombatDialogueAttackMaxElapsedTime
	10 to 60
fAISocialTimerForConversationsMin
	10 to 30
fAISocialTimerForConversationsMax
	30 to 90
fAISocialRadiusToTriggerConversationInterior
	500 to 50

---------------------------------
Install
---------------------------------
Go to: Drive Letter:\\Program Files\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\\Data\\
For those who don\'t have bought the game on steam, the SkyrimPrefs.ini file is located in Drive Letter:\\Users\\[USERNAME]\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim

1. Drop the chosen ESPs in that folder (I recommend storing the excess ones in their own folder, to stop clutter in the Data folder)
2. Launch the Skyrim Launcher, and click on \'Data Files\'
3. Tick the chosen ESPs and click \'Ok\'

---------------------------------
Data Files grayed out?
---------------------------------
Go to: Drive Letter:\\Program Files\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim\\Skyrim\\SkyrimPrefs.ini

For those who don\'t have bought the game on steam, the SkyrimPrefs.ini file is located in Drive Letter:\\Users\\<USERNAME>\\Documents\\My Games\\Skyrim

Add these lines, or change them if they already exist so they match the below:
	[Launcher]
	bEnableFileSelection=1

If that fails:
	Go to: Drive Letter:\\Users\\[USERNAME]\\AppData\\Local\\Skyrim
	Make the Skyrim folder un-read only.
author: Xylozi

files.name: Less Talkative NPCs - No Combat Changes
